title: Target Just Lost Its Merchandise Chief to Bed, Bath & Beyond. Why Even a Small Stock Drop Is an Overreaction.
text:
Target stock was drifting lower Thursday morning, a day after the company’s head of merchandise left to become the new chief executive at Bed Bath & Beyond.

The back story. Target shares (ticker: TGT) are up 67% year to date, leagues ahead of other retailers, including rivals Walmart (WMT) and Amazon.com (AMZN), and the broader market. The company has enjoyed record earnings, analyst praise, and signed high-profile partnerships. Its size and scale have allowed it to adapt more quickly to the new normal in retail, allowing...
description: Target stock was drifting lower Thursday morning, a day after the company’s head of merchandise left to become the new chief executive at Bed Bath & Beyond.
